item.title: President Trump Promotes Revised Version Of GOP Health Care Bill
item.description: May 1, 2017 - President Trump is promising great things from the revised version of the Republican health care bill. He said it would lower premiums, increase competition and protect people with pre-existing conditions "beautifully."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 1, 2017 - President Trump is promising great things from the revised version of the Republican health care bill. He said it would lower premiums, increase competition and protect people with pre-existing conditions "beautifully." http://www.npr.org/2017/05/01/526436036/president-trump-promotes-revised-version-of-gop-health-care-bill

item.title: Why Mexican Chefs, Farmers And Activists Are Reviving The Ancient Grain Amaranth
item.description: May 1, 2017 - The nutritious indigenous plant is part of a movement to revive native crops and cuisines — and a means of restoring the health and economy of Oaxaca, one of Mexico's poorest states.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 1, 2017 - The nutritious indigenous plant is part of a movement to revive native crops and cuisines — and a means of restoring the health and economy of Oaxaca, one of Mexico's poorest states. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/05/01/526033083/why-mexican-chefs-farmers-and-activists-are-reviving-the-ancient-grain-amaranth

item.title: Fasting Studies Clash With Our Desire To Eat What We Want, When We Want It
item.description: May 1, 2017 - Fasting every other day is no better for losing weight or keeping it off than restricting calories every day, a study suggests. And it's yet another example of how hard it is to study fasting.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 1, 2017 - Fasting every other day is no better for losing weight or keeping it off than restricting calories every day, a study suggests. And it's yet another example of how hard it is to study fasting. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/01/526069419/fasting-studies-clash-with-our-desire-to-eat-what-we-want-when-we-want-it

item.title: NIH Study Aims To Unravel The Illness Known As 'Chronic Fatigue Syndrome'
item.description: May 1, 2017 - Researchers do not know what causes people with the condition now known as ME/CFS to suffer debilitating exhaustion and other symptoms that make many everyday activities all but impossible.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 1, 2017 - Researchers do not know what causes people with the condition now known as ME/CFS to suffer debilitating exhaustion and other symptoms that make many everyday activities all but impossible. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/01/526372209/nih-study-aims-to-unravel-the-illness-known-as-chronic-fatigue-syndrome

item.title: Celebrity Chef Tom Colicchio: 'We Can End Hunger In This Country'
item.description: May 1, 2017 - The Top Chef judge, restaurateur and hunger advocate says many of our nation's problems are related to food. One of the biggest ways to address this is to make meals more nutritious and accessible.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 1, 2017 - The Top Chef judge, restaurateur and hunger advocate says many of our nation's problems are related to food. One of the biggest ways to address this is to make meals more nutritious and accessible. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/05/01/526048187/celebrity-chef-tom-colicchio-we-can-end-hunger-in-this-country

item.title: A Lazarus Patient And The Limits Of A Lifesaving Stroke Procedure
item.description: May 1, 2017 - About 800,000 people have strokes each year in the U.S. Most are caused by clots that block blood to the brain. In some cases, doctors can remove the clot using a device that looks like a fishing net.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 1, 2017 - About 800,000 people have strokes each year in the U.S. Most are caused by clots that block blood to the brain. In some cases, doctors can remove the clot using a device that looks like a fishing net. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/01/525896731/a-lazarus-patient-and-the-limits-of-a-lifesaving-stroke-procedure

item.title: Yo-Yo Dieting May Pose Serious Risks For Heart Patients
item.description: May 1, 2017 - People with heart disease should keep their weight down, but it can be hard to lose weight and keep it off. Now a study shows big fluctuations may increase the risk of heart attack and stroke.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 1, 2017 - People with heart disease should keep their weight down, but it can be hard to lose weight and keep it off. Now a study shows big fluctuations may increase the risk of heart attack and stroke. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/01/526048767/-yo-yo-dieting-poses-serious-risks-for-heart-patients

item.title: The Surprising Wishes Of India's Sex Workers
item.description: April 30, 2017 - A researcher found that some of them don't want to be "rescued." And that in one community, sex work is a traditional occupation for married women.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 30, 2017 - A researcher found that some of them don't want to be "rescued." And that in one community, sex work is a traditional occupation for married women. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/04/30/518156410/the-surprising-wishes-of-indias-sex-workers

item.title: A Trauma Nurse Reflects On 'Compassion Fatigue'
item.description: April 30, 2017 - Years of treating grievously injured people starts to wear on a person, a trauma nurse in Minneapolis says. She explores "compassion fatigue" in a semi-autobiographical poem.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 30, 2017 - Years of treating grievously injured people starts to wear on a person, a trauma nurse in Minneapolis says. She explores "compassion fatigue" in a semi-autobiographical poem. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/30/526056664/a-trauma-nurse-reflects-on-compassion-fatigue

item.title: Being A Guinea Pig For Science Can Be A Long, Slow Slog
item.description: April 30, 2017 - Brandie Jefferson volunteered for a clinical trial to see if intermittent fasting can help treat multiple sclerosis. Five months in, she realizes that this study won't answer that question.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 30, 2017 - Brandie Jefferson volunteered for a clinical trial to see if intermittent fasting can help treat multiple sclerosis. Five months in, she realizes that this study won't answer that question. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/30/526047449/being-a-guinea-pig-for-science-can-be-a-long-slow-slog

item.title: Those TV Drug Ads Distract Us From The Medical Care We Need
item.description: April 29, 2017 - Doctors spend lots of time answering questions about the latest drug ad, and that means less time answering questions that could really help your health, a primary care physician says.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 29, 2017 - Doctors spend lots of time answering questions about the latest drug ad, and that means less time answering questions that could really help your health, a primary care physician says. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/29/525877472/those-tv-drug-ads-distract-us-from-the-medical-care-we-need

item.title: U.S. Supply Of Yellow Fever Vaccine Will Run Out By Midsummer
item.description: April 28, 2017 - Officials are working on an emergency import deal for another vaccine that is not licensed in the U.S. Even then, a limited number of doses will be available at only a small number of clinics.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 28, 2017 - Officials are working on an emergency import deal for another vaccine that is not licensed in the U.S. Even then, a limited number of doses will be available at only a small number of clinics. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/28/526067401/u-s-supply-of-yellow-fever-vaccine-will-run-out-by-midsummer

item.title: His Parents' Death Gave Him A Mission: Stop The Medical Brain Drain
item.description: April 28, 2017 - Chris Ategeka left his native Uganda and earned an engineering degree in the U.S. He could have gone to Silicon Valley — but his personal history set him on a different path.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 28, 2017 - Chris Ategeka left his native Uganda and earned an engineering degree in the U.S. He could have gone to Silicon Valley — but his personal history set him on a different path. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/04/28/525756657/his-parents-death-gave-him-a-mission-stop-the-medical-brain-drain

item.title: For Some, Pre-Hospice Care Can Be A Good Alternative To Hospitals
item.description: April 28, 2017 - Through home visits, very ill people get help with pain, stress and symptoms. Medical centers, initially skeptical, now embrace the program because it helps patients and makes financial sense.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 28, 2017 - Through home visits, very ill people get help with pain, stress and symptoms. Medical centers, initially skeptical, now embrace the program because it helps patients and makes financial sense. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/28/524512767/for-some-pre-hospice-care-can-be-a-good-alternative-to-hospitals

item.title: New Health Care Bill Needs Moderate Republicans' Support — What Do They Want?
item.description: April 27, 2017 - NPR's Audie Cornish talks with moderate Republican Congressman Leonard Lance of New Jersey about what he's looking for in the new health care bill.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 27, 2017 - NPR's Audie Cornish talks with moderate Republican Congressman Leonard Lance of New Jersey about what he's looking for in the new health care bill. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/27/525918227/new-health-care-bill-needs-moderate-republicans-support-what-do-they-want
